scenarios.name: Cost-conscious business user gets cheapest responses

steps.text: a ModelRouter instance
a "cost_optimized" routing policy with a max cost of $0.05
a "local" provider is configured with a cost of $0.01 and priority 5
a "grok" provider is configured with a cost of $0.08 and priority 10
a business user sends a query
the router should select the "local" provider
the "grok" provider should not be called

scenarios.name: Production system fails over to backup provider

steps.text: a ModelRouter instance
a "failover" routing policy with fallback enabled
a primary "grok" provider is configured to fail
a backup "local" provider is configured to succeed
a user sends a technical query
the router should select the "local" provider after the primary fails

scenarios.name: Complex queries are routed by AI capability

steps.text: a ModelRouter instance
a "capability_based" routing policy requiring "REASONING" and "CODE_GENERATION"
a "local" provider is configured with "TEXT_GENERATION" capability and priority 10
a "grok" provider is configured with "REASONING" and "CODE_GENERATION" capabilities and priority 5
a user sends a query requiring code generation
the router should select the "grok" provider

scenarios.name: Administrator modifies routing policies at runtime

steps.text: a ModelRouter instance
a "local" provider is configured with priority 5 and 60 max requests per minute
the administrator loads a new configuration with priority 10 and 120 max requests per minute
the router's configuration should be updated successfully
the system should continue to operate correctly

scenarios.name: DevOps engineer configures router from environment variables

steps.text: a ModelRouter instance
the environment is configured for "failover" routing with a "local" provider
the router is created from the environment
its configuration should match the environment variables

scenarios.name: Operations team monitors system health and performance

steps.text: a ModelRouter instance
a "local" provider is configured for health checks
3 requests are sent to the router
the provider status should report as "healthy"
show 3 recent requests
a working repository
I run a no-op acceptance step
the placeholder should pass

scenarios: Cost-conscious business user gets cheapest responses
Production system fails over to backup provider
Complex queries are routed by AI capability
Administrator modifies routing policies at runtime
DevOps engineer configures router from environment variables
Operations team monitors system health and performance
